title: Public Information Act Request – Department Manual and Officer Gregory Ceraso Disciplinary History

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Public Information Act Request – Department Manual and Officer Gregory Ceraso Disciplinary History
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Dear Records Custodian,

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, Chapter 552 of the Texas Government Code, I respectfully request access to a copy of the Dallas Police Department’s full and current policy and procedures manual. This includes, but is not limited to:

General Orders

Department Handbook

Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs)

Rules and Regulations Manual

Any written directives, protocols, or administrative manuals governing:

Officer conduct

Traffic enforcement procedures

Use of force

Body-worn camera policy

Complaint intake and internal investigations

Search and seizure

Arrest protocols

Vehicle stops and detentions

Personnel accountability

Any other department-wide operational guidance

In addition, I request access to all internal and external complaints, disciplinary actions, and investigative findings involving Officer Gregory Ceraso from the start of his employment with the Dallas Police Department to the end of his tenure there. This includes:

Citizen complaints (sustained, not sustained, unfounded, or exonerated)

Internal affairs investigations

Records of suspension, demotion, written reprimands, or terminations

Use-of-force reviews or reports

Any civil rights or misconduct claims involving Officer Ceraso

If any portion of the requested records is considered exempt, I request that you provide all non-exempt portions and include a written explanation referencing the applicable exemption(s) under Texas Government Code § 552.301.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Wayne
